title: Classroom objects: this / it’s
target_structures: Yes, it is / No, it isn’t

turns.text: No, it isn’t. It’s a pen.

accept: No, it isn’t. It’s a pen.
No, it is not. It’s a pen.

embedding_text:
[Lesson 1] Classroom objects: this / it’s
Tags: objects, this-it, questions
T: What’s this?
S: It’s a pen.
T: Is this a book?
S: No, it isn’t. It’s a pen.
T: Is it on the table?
S: Yes, it is.
Target vocab: pen, pencil, book, table, chair, what’s, this, it’s

title: Where is it? on / under / in

turns.text: No, it isn’t. It’s on the wall.

embedding_text:
[Lesson 1] Where is it? on / under / in
Tags: prepositions, where, objects
T: Where is the clock?
S: It’s on the wall.
T: Is it under the window?
S: No, it isn’t. It’s on the wall.
T: Where is the box?
S: It’s on the floor.
Target vocab: box, clock, window, wall, floor, on, under, in, where

title: Numbers 1–10: how many chairs?

turns.text: How many chairs are there in the room?

S: No, there aren’t. There are six chairs.

title: Long / short; large / small

S: No, it isn’t. It’s small.
T: Is the window large or small?
S: It’s large.
Target vocab: long, short, large, small, pencil, room, window

S: No, he isn’t. He’s a teacher.
T: Is Mrs Green in the room?
S: Yes, she is.
Target vocab: I’m, you’re, he’s, she’s, Mr, Mrs, room, man, woman

title: In front of / behind

turns.text: Are you in front of the table?

S: Yes, I am. I’m in front of the table.

title: What am I doing? (actions)

embedding_text:

T: Now what am I doing?
S: You’re closing the door.
T: And now? What am I doing?
S: You’re taking a book from the table.
Target vocab: opening, closing, putting on, taking from, doing, what am I doing

title: Open or closed? which?
